sections.title: Introduction to Martin Luther King Jr.
sections.description: Students will learn about the early life of MLK Jr. and his growing awareness of racial injustice.
learning_objectives: Students will recognize the early influences on MLK Jr.'s life.
Students will identify key aspects of MLK Jr.'s childhood.
Students will understand the influence of MLK's family and community on his views.
sections.what_must_be_covered: The early life of Martin Luther King Jr., including his family background, education, and childhood experiences.

sections.title: A Brief History of Slavery in America
sections.description: Students will explore the history and impact of slavery in America.
learning_objectives: Students will gain an understanding of the historical context of slavery.
Students will summarize the history of slavery in America.
Students will describe the conditions faced by enslaved people.
sections.what_must_be_covered: The origins and development of slavery in America, the conditions faced by enslaved people, and the abolition movement.

sections.title: The Civil Rights Movement
sections.description: Students will learn about the key events and figures in the Civil Rights Movement.
learning_objectives: Students will understand the significance of the Civil Rights Movement.
Students will identify major events and figures in the Civil Rights Movement.
Students will explain the movement's impact on society.
sections.what_must_be_covered: An overview of the Civil Rights Movement, including major events, figures, and its impact on American society.

sections.title: The Montgomery Bus Boycott
sections.description: Students will learn about the Montgomery Bus Boycott and its significance.
learning_objectives: Students will understand the impact of the Montgomery Bus Boycott.
Students will understand what sparked the Montgomery Bus Boycott.
Students will identify key people involved.
Students will explain how the boycott worked and its outcome.
sections.what_must_be_covered: The arrest of Rosa Parks, how the boycott was organized, the role of MLK, how long it lasted, and its success.

sections.title: The 'I Have a Dream' Speech
sections.description: Students will analyze the significance of MLK Jr.'s famous speech.
learning_objectives: Students will appreciate the significance of the 'I Have a Dream' speech.
Students will analyze the main themes of the 'I Have a Dream' speech.
Students will understand the historical context and impact of the speech.
sections.what_must_be_covered: The main themes and historical context of the 'I Have a Dream' speech and its impact on the Civil Rights Movement.

sections.title: Comparing Past and Present: Racial Injustice
sections.description: Students will compare historical and current instances of racial injustice.
learning_objectives: Students will understand the connections between past and present racial injustices.
Students will compare historical and current examples of racial injustice.
Students will discuss social progress and ongoing challenges.
sections.what_must_be_covered: A comparison of historical and current instances of racial injustice, including social progress and ongoing challenges.

sections.title: Art Project: Symbols of the Civil Rights Movement
sections.description: Students will create art representing symbols of the Civil Rights Movement.
learning_objectives: Students will express understanding of the Civil Rights Movement through art.
Students will create art pieces representing Civil Rights symbols.
Students will explain the significance of their chosen symbols.
sections.what_must_be_covered: Creating art that represents symbols of the Civil Rights Movement, with a focus on creativity and reflection on the chosen symbols.

sections.title: Exploring MLK Jr.'s Speeches
sections.description: Students will explore various speeches by MLK Jr. and their messages.
learning_objectives: Students will appreciate MLK Jr.'s skills as a speaker.
Students will analyze themes and messages in MLK Jr.'s speeches.
Students will identify rhetorical techniques used in the speeches.
sections.what_must_be_covered: An exploration of various MLK Jr. speeches, focusing on themes, messages, and rhetorical techniques.

sections.title: The Role of Youth in the Civil Rights Movement
sections.description: Students will learn about the involvement of youth in the Civil Rights Movement.
learning_objectives: Students will recognize the contributions of young people to the movement.
Students will identify the role of youth in the Civil Rights Movement.
Students will describe the impact of youth activism on the movement.
sections.what_must_be_covered: The involvement of youth in the Civil Rights Movement, including major contributions and impact.

sections.title: Civil Rights Movement Songs and Their Messages
sections.description: Students will explore songs from the Civil Rights Movement and their messages.
learning_objectives: Students will appreciate the role of music in social movements.
Students will analyze the messages of songs from the Civil Rights Movement.
Students will understand the role of music in the movement.
sections.what_must_be_covered: An exploration of songs from the Civil Rights Movement, their messages, and their cultural impact.

sections.title: Panel Discussion: The Relevance of MLK Jr.'s Teachings Today
sections.description: Students will participate in a panel discussion about the relevance of MLK Jr.'s teachings today.
learning_objectives: Students will articulate the relevance of MLK Jr.'s teachings in today's world.
Students will engage in a panel discussion on the relevance of MLK Jr.'s teachings today.
Students will develop communication and critical thinking skills.
sections.what_must_be_covered: A panel discussion where students debate the current relevance of MLK Jr.'s teachings, developing communication and critical thinking skills.

sections.title: Creating a Nonviolent Protest Plan
sections.description: Students will create a plan for a nonviolent protest on a current issue.
learning_objectives: Students will apply nonviolent strategies to modern issues.
Students will create a detailed plan for a nonviolent protest.
Students will present their plan to the class.
sections.what_must_be_covered: Creating a plan for a nonviolent protest addressing a current issue, including strategies and a class presentation.
